Controller

Class ViewsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.ViewsManager

  • public class ViewsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class helps to manage the flow of all the BaseView object in the application. This class manages the transitioning of one BaseView to another BaseView, or transitioning from one BaseView to the previous BaseView

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.ArrayList<BaseView> views
      This is the ArrayList of views, which is imagined to be our views stack It contains all the views that are currently in the view stack

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private ViewsManager()
      Constructor is made private because this class is only used for the purpose of managing the Views via the static methods and the static variable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void popTillView(java.lang.Class<?> viewClass)
      This method will continuously pop BaseView objects from the views stack until it founds a BaseView object at the top of the stack that is of the specified class type.
      static void popToBaseView()
      This method will keep popping BaseView object from the views stack until the views stack only contains one BaseView object.
      static void popView()
      This method helps to pop the current BaseView object that is on top of the stack Upon doing so, the next BaseView object that is now at the top of the views stack will be activated to show its content.
      static void popViews(int count)
      This method helps to pop multiple BaseView objects in the views stack at once.
      static void pushView(BaseView baseView)
      This method helps to push new BaseView onto the existing BaseView stack.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • views

        private static java.util.ArrayList<BaseView> views
        This is the ArrayList of views, which is imagined to be our views stack It contains all the views that are currently in the view stack

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewsManager

        private ViewsManager()
        Constructor is made private because this class is only used for the purpose of managing the Views via the static methods and the static variable. Hence it is not supposed to be instantiated.

    • Method Detail

      • pushView

        public static void pushView(BaseView baseView)
        This method helps to push new BaseView onto the existing BaseView stack. Upon doing so, this new BaseView on top of the stack is then activated to display its content
        Parameters:
        baseView - The BaseView object to be pushed onto the views stack

      • popView

        public static void popView()
        This method helps to pop the current BaseView object that is on top of the stack Upon doing so, the next BaseView object that is now at the top of the views stack will be activated to show its content. If the views stack only contains one BaseView object, it will not be popped

      • popViews

        public static void popViews(int count)
        This method helps to pop multiple BaseView objects in the views stack at once. The parameter count specifies the number of BaseView objects to be popped from the views stack
        Parameters:
        count - The number of BaseView object to be popped from the stack at once

      • popTillView

        public static void popTillView(java.lang.Class<?> viewClass)
        This method will continuously pop BaseView objects from the views stack until it founds a BaseView object at the top of the stack that is of the specified class type.
        Parameters:
        viewClass - The BaseView Class that will stop the popping of views

      • popToBaseView

        public static void popToBaseView()
        This method will keep popping BaseView object from the views stack until the views stack only contains one BaseView object.
